author: Satchel Price
title: The Arizona Coyotes tweeted at their fans to stop doing the wave
text:
We wholeheartedly support this policy.
The Arizona Coyotes were in the middle of a thrilling game against the Anaheim Ducks on Monday night when something unacceptable happened. No, the team didn’t give up a sloppy goal or get busted for a brutal hit. It was even worse: fans in Section 112 starting doing the wave.
Luckily, the good people running the Coyotes’ Twitter account put out a crucial PSA to those in attendance at Gila River Arena:
Attention fans in 112: We don't do the wave here.
— #Yotes (@ArizonaCoyotes) February 21, 2017 There are maybe two occasions where doing the wave is acceptable in public, and “during the final minutes of a close NHL game” is nowhere near the list. Minor league baseball game? Fine, you’re probably there to have some wacky experiences and a few beers anyway. There’s a lot of downtime in baseball.
But the final minutes of an NHL game? That’s the time to hunker down and really focus on the entertainment product you presumably spent a bunch of money to attend in person. Who taught these people about waves in a desert anyway? 
Thank you, Arizona Coyotes, for fighting the good fight.
